meanings.definition: Cook (an egg) by boiling it in water.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy poaching eggs for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to poach an egg perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The chef was so skilled at poaching eggs, he could do it blindfolded!
meanings.sent4: Her method of poaching eggs was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The art of poaching eggs requires patience and precision.

meanings.definition: Illegally hunt or catch (game or fish) on land that is not one's own.
meanings.sent1: The criminals were caught poaching deer in the national park.
meanings.sent2: Poaching endangered species is a serious crime.
meanings.sent3: The idea of poaching fish from someone else's pond is just wrong.
meanings.sent4: He was poaching like a shadow in the night, unseen and unheard.
meanings.sent5: The poaching of wildlife threatens the balance of nature.
